content: <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <pubdate>20130508</pubdate>         <title>Food Stores</title>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>This layer contains information about retailers that sell food in Denver and in a 1.5 mile buffer around the Denver boundary. Stores are classified by type. This data layer was developed to support Denver's Food Retail Expansion to Support Health (FRESH) program. This layer will be stored on the City and County of Denver Spatial Database Engine (SDE) server. The data will be maintained on the SDE by the Office of Economic Development. It will be distributed through to City employees through the SDE and Locate-View-Map, and to the public through Open Data Catalog (and DenverMaps, if desired.) Data will be updated as time/staff permit, as data falls out of date, or through annual/bi-annual scheduled maintenance.Denver FRESH representatives will monitor Denver GIS requirements and submit current FRESH data layers to City SDE as applicable. Published data will comply with the City and County of Denver\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds requirements and Denver Environmental Health\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds GIS Cartographic Standards as described in the data layer\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds metadata file. Data sources that originate outside the City must be cited. City data beyond normal base layers should have the sources stated, or if the layer is \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdunusual\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd or time sensitive then the source and year should be stated.</abstract>       <purpose>Information about retailers that sell food in Denver and in a 1.5 mile buffer around the Denver boundary. Stores are classified by type; Ex: grocery store, supermarket, convenience store and food retail. The data is current as of October 2012, with some grocery store updates as of January 2014.  </purpose>     </descript>     <status>       <update>As needed</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-105.111197</westbc>         <eastbc>-104.715571</eastbc>         <northbc>39.834652</northbc>         <southbc>39.593448</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>economic development</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>economy</themekey>         <themekey>location</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Denver</placekey>         <placekey>Denver County</placekey>         <placekey>Colorado</placekey>         <placekey>USA</placekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>ACCESS CONSTRAINTS:   None.   USE CONSTRAINTS:   The City and County of Denver is not responsible and shall not be liable to the user for damages of any kind arising out of the use of data or information provided by the City and County of Denver, including the installation of the data or information, its use, or the results obtained from its use.   ANY DATA OR INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE City and County of Denver IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. Data or information provided by the City and County of Denver shall be used and relied upon only at the user's sole risk, and the user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the City and County of Denver, its officials, officers and employees from any liability arising out of the use of the data/information provided.   NOT FOR ENGINEERING PURPOSES</useconst>     <datacred>This data layer containing information about food retail locations was developed by the City and County of Denver Office of Economic Development and Department of Environmental Health (October 2012). Funding for this data was provided by Denver Health and Hospital Authority (DHHA) through a grant from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Additional funding was provided by the Colorado Health Foundation. Results of the Denver FRESH project work herein may be published jointly by DHHA and the City, or by either party separately, always giving due credit to the other party and to the CDC. Manuscripts prepared for publication must acknowledge the support by the City, the DHHA and the CDC.</datacred>     <secinfo>       <secsys>AVAILABLE</secsys>       <secclass>Unclassified</secclass>       <sechandl>Available to the public and accessible through the Denver\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Open Data Catalog, http://data.denvergov.org/</sechandl>     </secinfo>     <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.2.3200</native>   </idinfo>   <dataqual />   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Vector</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <sdtsterm>         <sdtstype>Entity <enttypl>BUSN_FOODSTORES_P</enttypl>       </enttyp>       <attr>         <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr> <attrlabl>HOURS</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Store hours.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SNAP</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Yes/No indicating if store accepts Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Programs (SNAP); also known as Food Stamps.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SIC</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Standard Industry Classification (SIC) code for the store.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>NAICS_EXT</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Eight digit North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SALES_VOL</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Estimated sales or assets in thousands.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>HDBRCH</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business Status - The code denoting whether the business is a headquarter, a branch, a subsidiary...</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>1</edomv>             <edomvd>Headquarters</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>2</edomv>             <edomvd>Branch</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>3</edomv>             <edomvd>Subsidiary Headquarters</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>NUMBER_EMP</attrlabl>         <attrdef>The number of employees for the business.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>EMPSIZ</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A range describing the number of employees for the business.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>A</edomv>             <edomvd>1-4</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>B</edomv>             <edomvd>5-9</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>C</edomv>             <edomvd>10-19</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>D</edomv>             <edomvd>20-49</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>E</edomv>             <edomvd>50-99</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>F</edomv>             <edomvd>100-249</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>G</edomv>             <edomvd>250-499</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv> <edomvd>1000-4999</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>J</edomv>             <edomvd>5000-9999</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>K</edomv>             <edomvd>10000+</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>FRNCOD</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Franchise Status - An additional sub-classification of certain Standard Industry Classification (SIC) codes used to identify franchise/brand affiliation or professional specialty.  Related to the selected SIC only.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>SQFT</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A range describing the square footage of the business.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>A</edomv>             <edomvd>1-2499</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>B</edomv>             <edomvd>2500-9999</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>C</edomv>             <edomvd>10000-39999</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>D</edomv>             <edomvd>40000+</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>Source</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Data source.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>STORE_TYPE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A description of the store type.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Census Bureau and USDA Economic Research Service</attrdefs>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>SM Supermarket </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments primarily engaged in retailing a general line of food, such as canned and frozen foods; fresh fruits and vegetables; and fresh and prepared meats, fish, and poultry represented as major departments. Supermarkets have at least $2 million in annual sales. Ex: King Soopers, Safeway.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>SGS Small Grocery Store  (excluding convenience stores)</edomv>             <edomvd>Sub-supermarket sized establishments primarily engaged in retailing a general line of food, such as canned and frozen foods; fresh fruits and vegetables; and fresh and prepared meats, fish, and poultry. Included in this category are delicatessen-type establishments primarily engaged in retailing a range of food and meat products. Ex: Marczyk\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds, Bombay Bazaar.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>CS Convenience store without gasoline</edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments known as convenience stores or food marts (except those with fuel pumps) primarily engaged in retailing a limited line of goods that generally includes food products such as milk, bread, soda, and snacks.  Ex: Russell\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds, Friendly Market, 7-Eleven (without gas).</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>CSG Convenience store with gasoline </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments engaged in retailing automotive fuels (e.g., diesel fuel, gasohol, gasoline) in combination with convenience store or food mart items. These establishments can either be in a convenience store (i.e., food mart) setting or a gasoline station setting. Ex: Circle K, Valero, 7-Eleven (with gas).</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>SPCL Specialized foodstore </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments primarily engaged in retailing specialized lines of food such as meat, fish and seafood, produce, bakery products, nut and confectionary, dairy products, and/or culturally specific items.  Ex: Carniceria La Luz, Ethio Mart,  Omaha Steaks.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>WCS Warehouse Club store </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments primarily engaged in retailing a general line of groceries in combination with general lines of new merchandise, such as apparel, furniture, and appliances.  Warehouse club stores typically charge an annual membership fee.  Ex: Costco, Sam\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Club.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>SC Supercenter/superstore </edomv>             <edomvd>Retail establishments primarily engaged in retailing a general line of groceries in combination with general lines of new merchandise, such as apparel, furniture, and appliances.  Supercenters typically contain a supermarket-like area within a larger general merchandise store.  Ex: Target, Walmart.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>DS Dollar store</edomv>             <edomvd>A variety merchandise store including some food items, typically priced at $1.00 or less.  Ex: Dollar Tree, Family Dollar.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>PMCY Pharmacy/drugstore </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments known as pharmacies and drug stores engaged in retailing prescription and/or nonprescription drugs and medicines, in addition to health and personal care products, and some food items. Ex: Walgreens, Rite Aid.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>         <attrdomv>           <edom>             <edomv>DMM Discount mass-merchandise/department store </edomv>             <edomvd>Establishments known as department stores that have central customer checkout areas, generally in the front of the store, and that may have additional cash registers located in one or more individual departments. Discount department stores in the retail food industry sell a wide range of general merchandise (except fresh, perishable foods). Ex: Big Lots.</edomvd>           </edom>         </attrdomv>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>POINT_X</attrlabl>         <attrdef>X coordinate generated from geocoded address.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>POINT_Y</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Y coordinate generated from geocoded address.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>STORE_NAME</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Store name.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>Address_ID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Required field - Addresses outside Denver County may not be populated.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Address Database</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>ADDRESS_LINE1</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business site address - line1.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>ADDRESS_LINE2</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business site unit address - line 2.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>CITY</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business site city.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>STATE</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business site state.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>ZIP</attrlabl>         <attrdef>Business site zip code.</attrdef>         <attrdefs>Denver Office of Economic Development</attrdefs>       </attr>       <attr>         <attrlabl>GlobalID</attrlabl>         <attrdef>A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data. </attrdef>         <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>       </attr>     </detailed>   </eainfo>   <distinfo>     <distrib>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>City and County of Denver, Technology Services / DenverGIS Data</cntorg>         </cntorgp>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>unknown</addrtype>           <address>201 W Colfax Ave, Dept 301</address>           <city>Denver</city>           <state>CO</state>           <postal>80202</postal>           <country>USA</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntfax>720-913-5237</cntfax>         <cntemail>denvergis@denvergov.org</cntemail>         <hours>M-F 8:00am - 4:30pm (MT)</hours>       </cntinfo>     </distrib>     <distliab>See access and use constraints information.</distliab>   </distinfo>   <metainfo>     <metd>20140203</metd>     <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn>     <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv>     <mettc>local time</mettc>   </metainfo> </metadata>
